We did notice the bar closes early and felt rushed out the door, even though it was only 11:00 PM. I couldn't find any posted hours of operation, so I am not sure what that was all about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Game!”
Reviews.Author: BratTee1
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are attending Mariners baseball game. Loved the hotel, room, and location. Shuttle was a huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: jtjtjtjtj
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively all year round and do many trips to Seattle. I was booked at the Stadium hotel through expedia corporate travel and first thing I did was go on trip advisor. I read some of the train noise complaints which made me a little hesitant, but in the defense of the train station and the hotel, the hotel is right by the train station (great for train travelers) and being that Seattle is a major city THERE IS GOING TO BE CITY NOISE i.e. busses, trains, games and lots of people. I have stayed at pretty much every hotel in or around the downtown Seattle area and find this hotel to be great. I will definately look forward to being booked again at the Silver cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for baseball”
Reviews.Author: soxgal78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights last week to see the Mariners vs. the Red Sox. You CANNOT beat this location if your primary goal is to catch baseball games. Our room, on the 5th floor, looked directly into the park, and was very nicely equipped. The hotel's newness is another big plus -- everything was clean, and while not necessarily luxurious, certainly very nice (especially the big screen TV in the room!). The hot tub was a generous size, and while we didn't go in the pool, it looked nice. One note about location -- I know a lot of people on Trip Advisor recommend staying in a more central location, downtown by the market, but this worked great for us. It was a 10-minute walk, if that, to Pioneer Square with restaurants and bars, and not even another 10 minutes to the Pike Place Market. The weather was nice, so the walks each day were really nice and enabled us to build in workouts we probably wouldn't have otherwise gotten (though there was a small workout room with some nice equipment). The hotel does have a free shuttle to downtown points, though we didn't use that. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel. Have fun in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here, May 17, 2008, for a one night stay to see a baseball game and for the convenience to the piers. We were going on a cruise the following day. The staff was extraordinarily friendly! Check-in was a breeze and the bellman was right there at the cab to greet us with his lugguage cart. The room was very nice. Loved the hugh flat screen on the wall and the bathroom had a nice big tub with a great shower head! You are literally across the street from the ballpark. FABULOUS!!! Now for the trains. Our room was was on the opposite side of the building from the train tracks. The only time we heard the trains was in the morning hours the next day. Not that big of a deal, but if we had stayed closer to them I could see where there would be a problem. I never heard anyone out in the hallways or doors slamming and our hotel was packed. Great place for a one night stay. The piers are a 10 minute cab ride, depending on traffic, or the hotel has a free shuttle bus to nearby attractions like the public market or the piers. We used the shuttle to go the market and we were the only people on the bus. Unfortunately, we could not use the shuttle to get to the piers due to the afternoon baseball game traffic, but the hotel paid for our cab becuase they felt so terrible about us waiting there so long. We had only waited ten minutes before they called the cab over. OUTSTANDING STAFF!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuffyMo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an overnight to see a baseball game. Rooms are great -- new, nicely appointed, large screen digital TV. Staff was very courteous & helpful. Yes, the trains go by--we asked for the quietest room possible, and got one on the interior courtyard. We could hear the trains in the late afternoon (in our room) but that night had no problem sleeping and didn't hear a single train. Overall a great experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you love listening to trains all night long, stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: krazygreekgirl
Reviews.Content: Wanted to spend the last night of our trip in the downtown area of seattle to see a Mariners game. Great views of the stadium, its right across the street. Nice clean room, unfortunately the toilet was wobbly, it's a new hotel!!!!! The worst thing was the constant trains that pass by, about every 25 minutes the whistles go off and it comes barreling through. If you don't need any sleep and want to soak up the city, great place to stay. I don't recommend this to a family, older couple or anyone who wants to sleep!!!!!!! Valet is the only choice and be prepared to spend $22 a day. I would much rather stay at the crown plaza, this silver cloud did not meet the expectations we had.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! New Favorite Hotel Chain!”
Reviews.Author: Alatini21
Reviews.Content: Hello We went to an event at the Qwest center and this hotel was perfect! We literally walked out the doors and we were there. Also, you are right by downtown and very close to the marina etc. We were able to sit in our room hottub and look out at the Ferry coming in each day and also the Space Needle and the Seattle skyline! I booked their King Jacuzzi Suite (OMG What a room!) and we stayed for two nights. Like I mentioned the view was fantastic and in addition to them giving us a new loofah, bath robes, bath salts, bath bubbles, a HUGE bathroom with a HUGE additional bath, big shower, kitchen/bar, microwave, extra sink, fridge, comfy bed, 40" FLATSCREEN TV with HD Channels and HBO etc and free Wi-Fi we were in heaven! Very nice stay the room was spotless and the bed was so comfy. Also, we landed and were at the hotel by 10:30am. We assumed (like most hotels) this place wouldnt let us check in early...but they actually allowed us to check into our room at 10:30am! We couldnt believe it. They were so accomodating and the front desk was REALLY nice. I know a couple of other reviews said they had problems with them, but I didnt have any issues at all. I would also suggest having breakfast at Jimmy's on 1st which is their restaurant. They have a good bloody mary and they do eggs benadict northwestern style which means they are served over Crab Cakes! :) YUM! Either way, you cannot beat the price on this room, the Hot Tub that is HUGE for two people, and the views this place has. I did hear the train that was passing in the front, but unlike some other reviews I read~ it didnt keep us up or really bug us :) Happy Travels. If you need more info let me know! Pictures to be uploaded soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying at the Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: northendmoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic if you are attending a Mariners or Seahawks game. You can't get any closer to the parks. From my hotel room, I could see directly into Safeco field where the players were stretching on the grass. The beds are incredible. I wish my bed at home was this nice. The TV's are ~48" flat panel LGs. The bathrooms are large and spotless. There is a wetbar with fridge & sink in the room. And there is a very nice 1850 watt hairdryer in every bathroom (unlike the 1200 watt dryers that you see in most hotels). The staff was helpful. Check in was fast and painless

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, clean and new, very handy for railway station”
Reviews.Author: mulac21
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Silver Cloud Stadium Hotel for a one night stay after arriving in from London. As I was due to take the train to Vancouver the following morning at 07.40, I booked this hotel as it was cheap and because of positive reviews on TripAdvisor. And I was pleased I did. Firstly the hotel was about 5 minutes walk from the railway station, which means The rooms were new and clean. I stayed in a room with a huge king bed, with a huge flatscreen TV on the wall. The bathrooms are roomy, with a very nice shower. One note, the hotel does not provide shower gel in the rooms. As for the location, it was excellent for the train station and also of course for the stadia. I was staying in a room with a direct view of one of the scoreboards (Safeco Field ... as I live in UK I don't know which sport this is ... I think it's baseball!). However it is not really near anything else, certainly I could find no convenience stores etc. The hotel restaurant was nice. We had a good (if a little pricey) breakfast, but it was a la carte. Room service in the evening was excellent value and good quality. The hotel is really let down by its reception staff. When I arrived to check in, I gave my name, the guy on reception looked up my reservation and laughed. I asked him what was funny, he said there was a note on my reservation, I asked what it said he said he couldn't tell me. Made me feel a little uncomfortable. Then later asked another guy at reception for directions - he couldn't even find the hotel on the map. And in the morning checking out I had to wait 10 minutes foe someone to appear at the desk and then they had charged me for 2 nights parking when (a) it would have been a very long drive from London (!!!!) and (b) I only stayed for 1 night. No apologies, I had to justify it coming off. Also there is no doorman, which can make finding a cab hard (and opening the doors with lots of luggage). And they do not have umbrellas - so bring one - it rains a lot in Seattle I hear. Overall I had a very comfortable stay with a very good room and decent food. Service at reception was, however, unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “One word - " Noisy"”
Reviews.Author: yvan31
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby area and a big plasma tv in the room; room is small but should be ok for a short getaway; the bed is comfortable BUT the noise from the railway just keeps me awake for the WHOLE night!!!! Prepare earplugs or don't stay at this hotel at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: annabanana59
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Cloud Nine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Seattle. This hotel helped made this trip the best. We had the King Jacuzzi Suite and it was sweet. We arrived in Seattle at 9:30am and didn’t' think we would be able to check in but no problem, we went right to the room. It was immaculate. The Jacuzzi had a beautiful view of Puget Sound. There were bath salts, gel and a loofa (sp?) We used it every night!!! The water was so HOT the first night that we had to wait for it to cool down. The bathroom was equally impressive. Large tub and plenty of space for toiletries. The bed was very comfortable. I read reviews about train noise but I have to say, we only heard the train while we were awake. We are sound sleepers and sleep with the TV on so, unfortunately, that may be why. Worked for us. We spent two days at Pikes Market...I love it. One day we used their shuttle, which was great. The next day we took a cab from a pub we were at and walked back. It was a great walk and found a little "specialty shop" on the way back. Jacuzzi time again. My husband loved the plasma and daily newspaper. OK, I will admit we were there for the Seahawk/Rams game and we are Rams fans, yuk. The location is no less than perfect for Safeco and Qwest. The Pyramid Ale House is across the street, which is fun. Jimmy's downstairs has the best breakfast. Their potatoes are awesome as are the Bloody Marys. We had room service our last morning and it was perfect and not prices any higher than going to the restaurant...a first!!! We loved it and won't stay anywhere else. Hope you like it too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: dudesd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from seattle. First time visiting and this hotel made it just the best experience. We loved the room, sooo clean and lovely to sleep in. The tv and movie service just topped off our evenings. The pool/hottub area are just awesome and overlook the pier area and the safeco field. It has a nice restaurant in the hotel as well right across the street. It is a little far to walk some days to the pike market or pioneer square but the shuttle offered could not of been any better. When we called for pickup it seemed like we waited no time at all and the drivers were fantastic with all sorts of suggestions. We used the shuttle extensively and it never let us down. Will definitely be staying here again. Nothing but good to say

HotelInfo.Name: Silver Cloud Hotel Stadium
HotelInfo.Address: 1046 1st Avenue South, Seattle, WA 98134
